story.title: #Waterloo200
story.description: To mark the 200th anniversary of the Battle of Waterloo, historian Andrew Roberts joined #BonaparteAndTheBritish Curator Sheila O'Connell for a live Q&A on Twitter

author.name: British Museum
author.bio: A museum of the world, for the world.

image.caption: For #Waterloo200 join #BonaparteAndTheBritish curator Sheila and @aroberts_andrew for a Twitter Q&A at 14.00 BST http://t.co/PXs9GLtZr5

quote.text: @britishmuseum How come the Bonapartes lived in Chislehurst? We used to own their grand piano!

user.description: Fiercely loyal, slightly opinionated, reluctant urban-living hedonista. Love history, books & studying for my wine quaffications. Grammar & manners pedant.
user.name: Amanda M

meta.text: @britishmuseum How come the Bonapartes lived in Chislehurst? We used to own their grand piano!

quote.text: Napoleon I's nephew (Napoleon III) was exiled to Chislehurst after his defeat in the Franco-Prussian War. He died in 1873.

user.name: British Museum

meta.text: Napoleon I's nephew (Napoleon III) was exiled to Chislehurst after his defeat in the Franco-Prussian War. He died in 1873.

quote.text: @britishmuseum Why is Napoleon admired, revered, idolised? Obvious differences from Hitler but important parallels. #waterloo200

meta.text: @britishmuseum Why is Napoleon admired, revered, idolised? Obvious differences from Hitler but important parallels. #waterloo200

quote.text: .@Ophiolatrist The parallels are an attempted invasion of Britain and a failed one of Russia, but that's absolutely where the parallels end.

quote.text: @britishmuseum @JHGHendriks How did they clear it? Was it cremated? Burried in mass grave? What was the logistics like? And for humans?

user.description: Heritage Student. Loves Mangal Bazaar, museums and wide open spaces. Aspiring comics writer. Tweets about heritage conservation, bad jokes, spoilers et. al.
user.name: bhunte rage

meta.text: @britishmuseum @JHGHendriks How did they clear it? Was it cremated? Burried in mass grave? What was the logistics like? And for humans?

quote.text: .@mt_ris The horses were burnt and the humans were both cremated and buried. Some wounded lay on the battlefield for four days #Waterloo200

user.description: Made in Canada with UK parts. LFC Fan. Defender of the Strays. Tweet, Follow or get out of the way xo

meta.text: @britishmuseum Did Napoleon actually change his wife's name to Josephine because he didn't like her given name #Waterloo200

quote.text: @britishmuseum @aroberts_andrew How was the battle controlled? Drums,messages? Did regiments respond to the wrong drummers or instructions?

meta.text: @britishmuseum @aroberts_andrew How was the battle controlled? Drums,messages? Did regiments respond to the wrong drummers or instructions?

quote.text: .@marieksOz It was controlled by aides de camps carrying handwritten notes from the commanders to the generals on the spot #Waterloo200

user.description: A museum of the world, for the world. #DefiningBeauty #8mummies #IndigenousAustralia http://t.co/5UxT3u0eDy House rules: http://t.co/hZrF012mqd
user.name: British Museum

quote.text: @britishmuseum Did Napoleon really say Britain was a nation of shopkeepers?

user.description: Museum geek & puzzle lover from Exeter. Science & Engineering Curator at UCL (and Jeremy Bentham's auto-icon). @SocMusArch committee member. Views my own,etc.
user.name: Nick Booth

meta.text: @britishmuseum Did Napoleon really say Britain was a nation of shopkeepers?

quote.text: .@Nickuae Yes; it was a well known phrase from the period but was meant pejoratively #Waterloo200

quote.text: @britishmuseum The rain had an impact on Waterloo. If it had been as sunny as today, how differently would it have unfolded? #Waterloo200

user.description: Now-former student , bookworm, writer, baker, beatlemaniac, historian, wanderluster and all-round procrastinator extrodinaire.
user.name: Jake Dickens

meta.text: @britishmuseum The rain had an impact on Waterloo. If it had been as sunny as today, how differently would it have unfolded? #Waterloo200

quote.text: .@jacobdickens_ Waterloo did see sunshine; it was 17 June that saw torrential thunderstorms (1/2) #Waterloo200

user.description: A museum of the world, for the world. #DefiningBeauty #8mummies #IndigenousAustralia http://t.co/5UxT3u0eDy House rules: http://t.co/hZrF012mqd
user.name: British Museum

meta.text: .@jacobdickens_ Waterloo did see sunshine; it was 17 June that saw torrential thunderstorms (1/2) #Waterloo200

quote.text: .@jacobdickens_ If 17 June had been dry Napoleon might have attacked earlier, giving him more time before the Prussians arrived (2/2)
